fields.description:
We've had issues with large files (generally over 10 MB) even after the settings were changed to accomodate such large files. In the administrator area, I set the limit to be 50 MB.

There is no problem with uploading the file, but there's an issue with viewing/downloading it. The error message is:
Attachment File Not Found
The attachment you were trying to download could not be found in the attachment file store. Either the file has been removed manually or there was an error in removing the record of the attachment from Confluence.

If this attachment is no longer required you can remove it from Confluence on the attachments page. Otherwise, you will need to attach a new copy.

<< Back to attachments page
fields.summary: Unable to Access Large Attachments

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-13549].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When using the "Edit in Office" feature, Confluence copies over the previous comment in the new attachment version which can lead to falsely associating data to a user.

h3. Environment
* Confluence 6.x
* Any supported Microsoft Office package
* Internet Explorer

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Log in as "user1".
# Go to a page, click the ellipsis (...) button and select "Attachments".
# Add a Word attachment in the page with the text "user1 comment" in the comment field.
# Log out and log in as "user2".
# Go to the same page and use the "Edit in Office" function.
# Perform any change in the document and save it.

h3. Expected Results

Confluence should create a "version 2" of the attachment with no comment - considering that the "Edit in Office" does not provide a comment field when you save it.

h3. Actual Results

Confluence creates a "version 2" of the attachment with the same comment as the previous version.
 
h3.Workaround

Go to the attachment screen and remove the text at "New comment" field. This will only fix the comment for the current version of the attachment.
fields.summary: Office Connector copies previous version comment onto current attachment version upon saving

fields.description: We use excerpt and excerpt-inlcude macros extensively to benefit from modular documentation that can be reused in multiple consolidation documents.  However if you change the name of a document which is being included in the consolidation documents, you have to manually update all links plus it does not show you incoming links in the document info, so you have no idea how many documents are affected.
fields.summary: Excerpt Macro - does not update links or show incoming links

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-13537].
  {panel}

At the moment, only the last word typed in the quick nav is used as a prefix search with the remaining words will use a full text search.

For example, searching for _"doc conf"_ will locate _"confluence doc"_ while _"conf doc"_ will not. This will cause [some confusion|CONF-13192] with the quick nav as it isn't explicitly clear why the 2 searches come up with different results.

Having all the words use prefix search will create too much of a performance hit to be a viable option.

A good option is to implement autocompletion. For example, when typing in _"conf"_ the user will be prompted to complete the full text _"confluence"_, since there are no other pages that start with _"conf"_

This means that we can be fairly sure that the user will have entered the full text and there will be less confusion.
fields.summary: Autocompletion for Quick Nav

We really need this to get a proper rendering of a calendar.

fields.description:
1) The new "Configure whitelist" screen on the Confluence Admin Console loses the breadcrumbs. See environment details in "environment" section of this issue. See attached screenshot.

2) While we're at it, please change the page title to be title case, like the rest of Confluence. 
I.e. change this:
{quote}Configure whitelist{quote}
to this:
{quote}Configure Whitelist{quote}

3) Also, I'm wondering if the words "Restrict to listed domains " are correct, since you can enter an entire URL or a URL pattern, not just the domain? (If you change these words, remember to change both occurrences on the screen)

4) And we should change the button from "Save Configuration" to just "Save", for consistency with the rest of Confluence.

fields.description:
The RTE does not work if the configured base url is not used to edit a page.

For example, if you have http://localhost:8080/confluence set as your base url in general config and you access the wiki to edit a page with http://some_ip:8080/confluence, then the RTE does not load properly.

We do say in the documentation that Confluence must be accessed by the configured base url, however I believe there are a lot of instances that are setup this way anyway.

In the very least, we should show a warning message indicating that the user is trying to edit a page with a different url.
fields.summary: RTE doesn't work if configured base url is not used

fields.description:
When defining a Resource Plugin providing two properties files:

com/atlassian/confluence/core/ConfluenceActionSupport_de_DE.properties
com/atlassian/confluence/core/ConfluenceActionSupport_de_DE_ABCDEF.properties

In case of java.lang.ResourceBundle semantic every lookup is made through de_DE_ABCDEF, in case no value for a key was found a second lookup is made using the de_DE bundle.

Unfortunately Confluence is not following this common practice. Only {{ConfluenceActionSupport_de_DE.properties}} strings are being used.
fields.summary: Language Pack variants are not working

fields.description:
Confluence should support partial word matching.

If a wiki page has the word *adrecordset*, a search on {{recordset}} should include the page. Currently only a search on {{adrecordset}} or a search with wildcards returns the page.

Note that this is different than [CONF-7026] in light of how it was resolved. CONF-7026 was about matching page titles. This is about matching content in the body of a page.

This was intentionally filed as a bug; few products use an entire word as the default search granularity.
fields.summary: Support partial word matches

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

Hi,

We want to create an internal blackboard for our employees. Therefore we have created templates to give the reporter a clear structure format which information have to be included.

To list these information entered through our template we have labelled each template individually. Once you have completed the template it will automatically
create a new page. This new page will be shown through the Macro "Contentbylabel" on a certain page.

Once a new "entry" (altough it will be a new page) has been made it should inform everybody by email (through the Confluence Watchlist) that a new information has been posted on this page.
Unfortunately, the watchlist ignores such entries made by through the Macro "ContentbyLabel". Is there any way how we can fix this or if you could inform me which other ways I might have using Confluence and using a blackboard.

Thank you.

Best,

Oliver Heckert

fields.description:
As reported in CONF-7143, links that contain images with center alignment break when converted from the rich text editor. Eg {noformat} [!image.png|align=center!|Link Text] {noformat} Creates the following xhtml {noformat}
{noformat} Which creates the following wiki markup on the return trip {noformat} [|Link Text] !images-1.jpg|align=center! {noformat} * In the HTML an extra div with {{align=center}} is wrapped around the {{img}} tag because just setting {{align=centre}} on the {{img}} tag doesn't work on the major browsers, although {{align=right}} does. * This div is not valid HTML, since the {{a}} tag only allows inline children [http://www.w3.org/TR/html401/struct/links.html#h-12.2]. * As a result, the xhtml parser doesn't return the div within the link tag, and the conversion to wiki markup goes awry. h2. Possible fixes or partial fixes: * In markup -> all html: Find a better work-around for the non-working centre=align problem. (We've tried but came up with nothing) * In wysiwyg -> markup: Put in a really specific piece of logic to convert the broken dom back into the right wiki markup (two hacks don't make a nice piece of code) * In markup -> wysiwyg: Don't render the div for wysiwyg, letting the image show not-centred (violating the what you see is what you get bit) * In markup -> all html: Try to pass the need to centre the html back up to the paragraph containing the link? h2. Workarounds * None yet. (except Don't center images in links). Maybe use a macro to display images instead of the standard syntax.
fields.summary: Links containing images with center alignment break when converted from the rich text editor

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-13462].
  {panel}

Here's the scenario:

A user submitted a request from a Confluence page (containing a macro), which is submitted from the browser to Tomcat via HTTP. The requests (HTTP Connector) timed out after 2 minutes and Tomcat returns a [503 error|http://www.checkupdown.com/status/E503.html] to the browser. The database query however will still be executed.

A customer pointed out that the ability to cancel a request that takes unexpectedly long to complete - usually due to an error in page code - should be available to a page author or viewer.

A quote from the customer:
{quote}
Many is the time I have previewed a reporting macro invocation that I didn't want to complete, or tried to troubleshoot a user's problem and been stymied because editing the page required me to view it first, and the 503 message didn't allow the page to render so that I could click its edit link. I know, of course, that I could look up its content ID and invoke the editpage action independently, but that's time-consuming and irritating.

And, of course, 503 (service unavailable) is not what I would think of as an appropriate response to something that was taking too long to complete, though of course there may not be any other conclusion the respondant server could reach under the circumstances.

But in the final analysis I still can't imagine a case where a transaction - at least, one whose only purpose is to provide a response with no persistent side effect - should be allowed to continue after it is known for certain that the requestor will never receive that response. This is especially important when the user's most likely action in the face of such a situation is to try it again - often multiple times - raising the probability of deadlocks, delays and wasted resources that can build to performance-affecting - and even service-threatening - levels to near certainty.

Even for an action that does have persistent side effects, I would not find it acceptable to be uncertain of whether they had been executed under such conditions. If there is a meaningful risk that it may take unreasonably long to complete, it would be more sensible to use job scheduling to put it explicitly into the background, with the ability to monitor its state. 
{quote}

An interface that indicates running queries or actions might also be helpful in this case.
fields.summary: Admin configuration for database query/transaction timeouts

fields.description:
When displaying Excel documents - particularly those created on the Mac where microsoft inexplicably continues to default to a 1904 epoch - using the viewfiles plugin, the displayed dates are calculated relative to a 1900 epoch rather than the epoch set in the Excel workbook.

Microsoft describes the usage of the 1904 epoch flag in its kb article:  http://support.microsoft.com/kb/180162

The viewfiles macro of the Office Connector plugin should read the epoch flag and respond accordingly when displaying content from Excel.
fields.summary: viewfile macro does not observe the 1904 epoch flag in Excel documents when calculating dates

fields.summary: Can not get to blog post on EAC

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

* Edit a page in the rich text editor
* Insert the text "I am making a link to something"
* Highlight "making a link", select the link insertion dialog and make it link to www.example.com

Expected result:

* There is a space after the inserted link between "link" and "to"

Actual result:

* When returning from the link inserter, the space after the link is converted to a "thin space" character
* When the page is saved, the thin space is removed entirely and there is no space after the link

Reproduced in Safari 3.1.2. In FireFox 3, the thin space is inserted before the existing space instead of replacing it.
fields.summary: Rich text editor swallows the space after a link

fields.description:
This is an umbrella issue for a number of changes I've made to diffing for a 20% project. In short:

* Add optional diff section to notification emails
* Refactor diff code to produce POJOs, not hardcoded HTML
* Add context to diff results so that unnecessary context can be snipped / add JS to toggle context on page.
* More intelligent word diffing - changes to a line should be detected as different to line removals/additions. This should allow for insertions with concurrent line changes.
* Roll out new diff to email/view-changes/RSS/page-merge areas & deprecate old DiffUtils class
* tests for all levels of diff
fields.summary: Refactor page diffing and reinstate diffs in watch emails

fields.description: The TinyMCE editor is trying to interpret "file:" specially (presumably as a URL), and getting itself confused, to the point where the page won't save. fields.description:
Described [here|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/KB/CSP-22894+-+java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError+in+the+com.atlassian.confluence.core.actions.NotFoundAction+when+starting+Confluence+(or+during+upgrade)]. 

Debug logging looks like this:
2008-10-14 15:33:43,646 DEBUG [main] [atlassian.plugin.classloader.PluginsClassLoader] findClass Find class [ com.adaptavist.confluence.backups.UpdateHousekeepingAction ], found [ class com.adaptavist.confluence.backups.UpdateHousekeepingAction ]
2008-10-14 15:33:43,646 DEBUG [main] [atlassian.plugin.classloader.PluginsClassLoader] findClass Find class [ com.adaptavist.confluence.backups.UpdateHousekeepingAction ], found [ class com.adaptavist.confluence.backups.UpdateHousekeepingAction ]
2008-10-14 15:33:43,678 ERROR [main] [ContainerBase.[Standalone].[localhost].[/]] listenerStart Exception sending context initialized event to listener instance of class com.atlassian.upgrade.UpgradeLauncherServletContextListener
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: com/atlassian/confluence/core/actions/NotFoundAction

We should check for this class and disable the plugin before the plugin and class loads.
fields.summary: Class not found error when loading incompatible plugin, prevents confluence from starting

fields.description: jTDS 1.2.1 and later support a new kind of isolation called SNAPSHOT isolation that we're interested in trying to reduce deadlocks in SQL Server installations.
fields.summary: Update jTDS dependency to 1.2.2

fields.description:
!Insert Link.jpg!

For a popup that carries out 5 different operations there are only 2 xwork actions (PagePicker and ViewAttachment), and 2 implementations (one for draft, one for page). This is far from ideal, and this configuration has been causing avoidable bugs (CONF-13388 and CONF-13252).

The main problems are:
# PagePickerAction executes 5 operations (getHistoryPages, getSearchResults, getRecentlyUpdatedPages, getReferringPages and execute)
# the attachment tab works in a completely different way to the rest of the tabs
# wysiwyg-insertlink-popup.vm is littered with if statements that are very flaky. For example, the attachment tab and search tab both needs the spacekey parameter but for completely different operations. 

h2. Possible Solution
DraftManager should work more like PageManager so that confluence doesn't need to create 2 different implementations for retrieving what is essentially the same information. This would mean we can consolidate all our actions that we have split up to accomodate drafts (ViewPageAttachmentAction and ViewDraftAttachmentAction, ViewPagePickerAction and ViewPagePickerInDraftAction).
PagePickerAction should also be split up into 5 different actions so that it lines up more with the attachment tab.

Note: This is an issue that arose while fixing CONF-13388. PagePickerInDraftAction did not exist before CONF-13388 was resolved and was added as a quick fix but is not intended as a long term option.
fields.summary: Insert Link popup needs to be cleaned up

fields.description:
The wiki markup is not rendering correctly when pulled into a page via an excerpt-include.
___________
e.g.
The URL under the 'Cron-Based Scheduling' point in the document below is not rendering as a URL, but as the text of a URL:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Triggering+a+Build+on+Schedule

It is excerpt-including it from this page, which does render it correctly (see first sentence):
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Specifying+a+Cron-based+Schedule
____________

I've also had to remove curly brackets from font formatting markup, (e.g. {_} is sometimes used to format text to italics, instead of just _), as it was also not rendering it correctly in an include.
fields.summary: excerpt-include macro is not rendering wiki markup correctly

fields.description:
I just updated Extranet to add an outage notice to the Main Layout in Administration > Layouts.

This appeared straight away on node 1 of Extranet, where I made the change, but didn't appear on node 2. Going to node 2, Administration, Layouts, I could see that the layout was changed. Clicking edit and save (without making any changes) on node 2 was enough to propagate the changes.

Likely cause is some non-distributed cache -- perhaps we use a static HashMap or something, rather than the Coherence cache.
fields.summary: Layout customisations are not propagated to other cluster nodes

fields.description:
If an error occurs connection to the LDAP repository during the initial login, it is possible for this failure to be cached as the user not existing and so subsequent login attempts will be unsuccessful. 

The workaround for this is to manually flush the LDAP users cache
fields.summary: LDAP users can be cached as non-existant / not permitted to login if the LDAP repository is not available

fields.description:
Using the {gallery} macro in a page with 23 .jpg attachments results in the following error:

Error trying to draw image gallery org.apache.velocity.exception.ParseErrorException: Encountered "=" at line 64, column 37 of /templates/gallery-dynamic-slideshow.vm Was expecting one of: ... "-" ... "+" ... "*" ... "/" ... "%" ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ...

After trying the {gallery} macro on a new empty page, the same error occurs:

Error trying to draw image gallery org.apache.velocity.exception.ParseErrorException: Encountered "=" at line 64, column 37 of /templates/gallery-dynamic-slideshow.vm Was expecting one of: ... "-" ... "+" ... "*" ... "/" ... "%" ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ...
fields.summary: Gallery plugin error

fields.description: Updated to Confluence 2.9.2 and imported backup. In Confluence 2.9.1 everything was fine, but now the "Recently Updated" Page only gets an update when I restart Apache Tomcat. Where should I start invertigation? Thank you!
fields.summary: "Recently Updated" only updated when restarting Apache Tomcat

fields.description:
File with spaces in the name results in an upload that shows a broken link when uploading a profile picture.

It seems the link contains pluses instead of spaces which results to 404 "Page Not Found" error, 
i.e. 
the generated image link is /download/attachments/id/word1+word2.jpg?version=1
whereas the actual image is accessible by /download/attachments/id/word1 word2.jpg?version=1 ( or %20 )

I've found a lot of Confluence issues related to attachments with spaces in the filename but nothing specific to profile pictures.
fields.summary: Broken link of profile picture with spaces in the filename

fields.description:
It would be helpful to include the steps to migrate the Crowd delegation within the doc for Confluence upgrade. For example, the steps to migrate users to JIRA user management is included in Step 8 of the {{Performing the Upgrade}}.

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF28/Upgrading+Confluence+EAR-WAR+Edition
fields.summary: Include Crowd migration steps for Confluence upgrade within the doc
